headline: Lawyers seeking SAN rank bemoan difficulties in registration
summarized_story:

Little did we know that the automation which we all celebrated will make it impossible for some of us who are deserving of the SAN rank.

headline: NAICOM moves to shut insurance firms over claims failures
summarized_story:
NAICOMBy Rosemary IwunzeThe fate of over ten thousand life policyholders in Niger Insurance Plc and Standard Alliance Insurance Plc are now hanging in the balance as the National Insurance Commission, NAICOM, has issued 30 days’ notice to both companies to close shop over their inability to settle pending claims.
It will be recalled that the Nigeria Insurance Association, NIA, the umbrella body of insurance firms in the country, had suspended the two firms from its membership in June last year.
According to NIA, the expulsion became a necessary on the back of their defaults on obligations to policyholders especially on claims payment amongst others.

headline: DRUUP e-hailing cab business takes off in Kwara

headline: 2023: No plan to impose candidate in Ogun, APC clarifies
summarized_story:
By James Ogunnaike, AbeokutaChairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Ogun West Senatorial District of Ogun State, Mohammed Azeez, has faulted the claim by some leaders in the district that the party was planning to impose Senator Olamilekan Adeola on them as the Senatorial candidate of the party in the district ahead of the 2023 general elections.
Reacting to the allegation, the Chairman of APC in Ogun West Senatorial District said there was no plan to impose YAYI or any other candidate on the party.
Azeez described the report as “falsehood which was fictitiously concocted to discredit the party and Tinubu for no just cause”.
His words: “As the elected APC Ogun West Senatorial District Chairman, I am not aware of prominent leaders of All Progressives Congress from Ogun West meeting and asking our National Leader, Asiwaju Tinubu not to impose Senator Olamilekan Adeola, on them.
“The duly elected leadership of APC in Ogun West Senatorial District have equally not received any request to imposed anyone in any position in the race towards 2023.

headline: Ramadan: Buni reviews curfew in Yobe
summarized_story:
By Ndahi Marama, DamaturuGovernor Mai Mala Buni of Yobe state, on Monday, approved a review of the curfew restricting human and vehicular movements across the state.
He gave the approval following improvement in the security situation and the ongoing Ramadan.
“The new curfew time will now commence from 12 midnight, as against the usual 11p.m., to 6a.m.
“Muslim faithful, who wish to participate in the Tahajud prayer in this holy month of Ramadan, are free to do so.
“Security agencies are advised to take note and adhere to the change, please,” General Abdulsalam stated.

headline: Ramadan: Government reduces working hours
summarized_story:
Jigawa State Government has approved the reduction of official working hours in the state by two hours.
This was contained in a statement signed by the State Head of the Civil Service, Alhaji Hussaini Ali Kila issued to DAILY POST on Monday.
The statement said the reduction of the working hours started from Tuesday after the commencement of Ramadan fasting.
According to the statement, “Civil Servants in the State are now to report to the office from 9am and close by 3pm while on Friday are to close by 1pm.”He explained that the reduction of the working hours is aimed at providing more opportunities to civil servants to prepare for their Ramadan break.
He, therefore, urged civil servants to use the Ramadan period to pray for God’s guidance and blessings for the state.

headline: I’ve paid price for the voiceless – Sacked Abuja Imam speaks, gets new appointment
summarized_story:
Former Chief Imam of the National Assembly Legislative Quarters Mosque, Sheikh Muhammad Nuru Khalid, says the termination of his appointment was a price he paid for Nigerians who have no voice.
According to him, he is set to lead his new congregation with effect from Friday, April 8.
“This is the price we pay for aligning with the people and identifying with their sufferings.
“By the Grace of Almighty Allah, I will be leading my new congregation this Friday, because as clerics we need a platform to operate.
“There’s a Jum’mat mosque we built behind the Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN Quarters, in Abuja; I will now be leading the congregation there.”

headline: You’re a fighter, strong grassroots mobiliser – Tinubu hails Oshiomhole at 70
summarized_story:
Former Lagos State governor, Senator Bola Tinubu, on Monday branded former Edo State governor, Mr Adams Oshiomhole, as a valiant fighter for the masses and a strong grassroots mobiliser.
In a statement issued in Lagos today, Tinubu congratulated Oshiomhole for his immense contributions to democracy and the development of an egalitarian society through his fabled advocacy of workers’ rights.
“Warm congratulations to a former Chairman of All Progressives Congress (APC), Comrade Adams Oshiomhole, on his 70th birthday,” Tinubu’s statement read in part.
“On this occasion, we pay a special tribute to Oshiomhole for his unwavering commitment to democracy and good governance.
“A valiant fighter for the masses and strong grassroots mobiliser, Oshiomhole has always worked in the interest of an average person.”Tinubu also prayed to God to grant Oshiomhole, who he described as an ‘intelligent and energetic man’, many more years and increased wisdom.

headline: Elon Musk’s Twitter stake dwarfs Jack Dorsey’s, now largest shareholder
summarized_story:
Business magnate, Elon Musk, now owns a 9.2 per cent stake in Twitter.
The U.S. agency confirmed that Musk bought 73,486,938 Twitter shares in March.
News of the stake, worth $2.89billion, boosted the company’s shares by about 25% in pre-market trading.
The Tesla founder becomes the largest shareholder with more than four times the 2.25 per cent controlled by Twitter founder Jack Dorsey.

headline: Lagos police avert clash as okada man stabs one to death
summarized_story:
A violent protest erupted yesterday in the Ipaja area of Lagos following the murder of a man by a commercial motorcyclist.

headline: Rising diesel price forces JAMB to raise mock UTME fee to N1,000
summarized_story:
Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB) has said candidates who will participate in the optional mock Unified Tertiary and Matriculation Examination (UTME) will pay N1,000 as service charge to computer-based test (CBT) centres where they will sit for the examination.
The examination body said it increased the service charge and that of other consumables from N600 to N1,000 because of the high cost of diesel in the country.
The mock examination will hold on April 9 in some select CBT centres.
JAMB had promised to provide soft-landing for CBT centres due to the hike in the price of diesel.

headline: JNI queries Fed Govt’s inability to wipe out bandits, terrorists
summarized_story:
The apex Islamic body in the North, Jama’atu Nasril Islam (JNI), under the leadership of the Sultan of Sokoto, Alhaji Muhammadu Sa’ad Abubakar III, has queried Federal Government’s inability to proactively take the battle to terrorists’ hideouts and wipe them off.
In its reaction to last week’s terrorists’ attack on the Abuja-Kaduna train, the Islamic body said the essence of government and governance is to protect the five principal cardinal rights of the human race.
Former President Olusegun Obasanjo also said the government appeared overwhelmed by the level of insecurity in the land.

headline: Nigeria has no big cake to share anymore — Obaseki
summarized_story:
Governor Godwin Obaseki of Edo has said Nigeria no longer has a big cake to share.
He said whoever wants to be the next president must be ready to bake a big cake for all Nigerians to share.
“Forty years ago, we had a big cake to share but today that cake has disappeared.
“Thanks for providing leadership and trust, God Almighty that has given you the wisdom to make Nigeria the higher goal.

headline: PDP govs tackle Presidency over state of the nation – The Sun Nigeria
summarized_story:
From Ndubuisi Orji, AbujaThe Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Governors, yesterday, berated the Presidency over its response to the opposition governor’s recent communique on the state of the nation.
The Forum, in a statement by its Director General, CID Maduabum, described the response of the Presidency through Garba Shehu as infantile.
The PDP governors noted that their March 23 communique merely stated the facts as it relate to the existential threat confronting the country under the All Progressives Congress (APC)-led administration.

summarized_story:
From Romanus Ugwu, AbujaAn All Progressives Congress (APC) group, Emefiele Solidarity Vanguard (ESV), has said that Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) Governor Dr Godwin Emefiele will be an unstoppable aspirant to replace President Muhammadu Buhari if he eventually declares his intention to run in the 2023 presidential election.
The leader of the pro-Emefiele group further said that the CBN governor is yet to accept the offer by Nigerians to succeed President Buhari when his tenure ends in 2023.
‘There is no doubt that Nigerians from all quarters, the North, the South, East and West are calling on the CBN governor to run as President in 2023.

headline: Saving public tertiary education in Nigeria
summarized_story:

headline: Elon Musk Becomes Largest Shareholder In Twitter

According to a document filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the South African-born billionaire acquired nearly 73.5 million Twitter shares — a 9.2 per cent stake in the company.
Musk launched a poll on Twitter on March 25, saying “free speech is essential to a functioning democracy.

headline: Gunmen attack Ondo lawmaker, Olugbenga Omole
summarized_story:
Unknown gunmen have attacked the chairman, Ondo State House of assembly Committee on Information, Olugbenga Omole on Thursday.
Omole who is representing Akoko Southwest Constituency 1, narrowly escaped assassination attempt on his life .
He escaped multiple gunshots were fired at his car by unknown gunmen in the heart of Akure, the state capital.
The lawmaker confirmed the incident to journalists.

headline: ‘NNPP will not fail like APC or PDP’- Senator Rabiu Kwankwaso
summarized_story:
It is no longer news that Senator Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso has left the People’s Democratic Party – the PDP – the party, which provided him the platform to become the Governor of Kano State, Minister of Defence and a Senator.
Kwankwaso, who emerged on Wednesday, last week in Abuja, as the new national leader of the New Nigeria People’s Party (NNPP), commands a large number of supporters since 2011 when he was re-elected as governor of the state.
Could it be that the senator is out for mischief against the PDP in Kano state, considering that he is not only a stakeholder but also a brand in his own right?
Or is it about contesting the 2023 presidential election on the platform of the NNPP?
To address all these issues, is SENATOR RABIU MUSA KWANKWASO, National Leader of the New Nigeria People’s Party, Former Governor of Kano State and Former Nigerian Minister of Defence.

headline: Soludo Offers Amnesty To Agitators + Imam Suspended For Criticising Buhari- Trending With Ojy Okpe
summarized_story:
Nigerians have reacted to the Suspension of ‘Nuru Khalid’ a chief Imam who last Friday, criticised the federal government’s handling of the security challenges in the country.
The Imam during his sermon accused President Mohammadu Buhari of failure in leadership.
In another development, the Governor of Anambra State Charles Soludo announced on Sunday that his administration has offered amnesty to agitators in the state.
Finally, Pictures of campaign vehicles of the central bank Governor Godwin Emiefele surfaced online over the weekend.

headline: Netherlands Coach Louis van Gaal Reveals He Has Prostate Cancer
summarized_story:
Netherlands head coach and former Manchester United boss Louis van Gaal has revealed he’s being treated for prostate cancer.
The 70-year-old made the admission on a television show in the Netherlands called Humberto on Sunday evening while promoting a new documentary about his life.

headline: California Police Search for Shooters Who Killed 6, Hurt 12
summarized_story:
In a matter of seconds, the latest U.S. mass shooting had left six people dead and 12 wounded.
Of the 12 wounded, at least four had critical injuries, according to the Sacramento Fire Department.
And it was the second mass shooting in Sacramento in the last five weeks.

headline: Nigeria Bars Outgoing Calls on SIM Cards not Linked to National Identification Number
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s federal government has barred all outgoing calls on every SIM card that is not linked to the National Identification Number (NIN) of the SIM card owner.
“As of date, over 125 Million SIMs have had their NINs submitted for immediate linkage, verification and authentication.
Similarly, the National Identity Management Commission (NIMC) has issued over 78 million unique NINs till date,” Pantami said.
Consequently, the Federal Government has directed all Telcos to strictly enforce the Policy on all SIMs issued (existing and new) in Nigeria.
Outgoing calls will subsequently be barred for telephone lines that have not complied with the NIN-SIM linkage Policy from the 4th of April, 2022.
